intro: Erigeron acris, commonly known as common fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron acris is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
